parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. To get all the results pass the value "all".

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `first_name`, `last_name`, `company`, `profession`, `vat_number`, `email__email`, `phones__number`, `addresses__address`, `addresses__city`, `addresses__state`

parameters.name: letter
parameters.description: Optionally filter by starting letter. Refers to the contact's "display_name."

parameters.name: ctype
parameters.description: Optionally filter by contact type. Either `client` or `supplier`.

parameters.name: profession
parameters.description: Optionally filter by profession.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Optionally filter by company.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `display_name`, `profession`, `vat_number`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-display_name`).

is_client.description: Whether or not the contact is a client

is_supplier.description: Whether or not the contact is a supplier

invoice_due.description: The contact's sum of invoices that are due

id.description: To update an existing object, provide the corresponding ID as it was returned to you by the API. To create a new object, omit the ID entirely.

email_type.description:
The email type. One of the following or blank (empty string):
<details>
<summary>List of values</summary>
Value | Description
--- | ---
`home` | Personal
`work` | Work
`other` | Other
</details>

client_portal_access.description: Whether the contact is allowed to access the client portal or not.

last_login.description: When the contact logged in to the client for the last time. ISO-formatted date and time.

id.description: To update an existing object, provide the corresponding ID as it was returned to you by the API. To create a new object, omit the ID entirely.

phone_type.description:
The phone type. One of the following or blank (empty string):
<details>
<summary>List of values</summary>
Value | Description
--- | ---
`home` | Home
`fax` | Fax
`mobile` | Mobile
`work` | Work
`other` | Other
</details>

next.description: URL to the next page, if any.

previous.description: URL to the previous page, if any.

401.description: Unauthorized request. User credentials were invalid or missing.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

post.description:
Create a new contact.
---
This endpoint will add a new contact to the organization.
Although `first_name`, `last_name` and `company` are not required
fields, at least one of them must be specified for the record
to be valid. The newly created record's ID is included in
the response.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data.

vat_number.description: The tax ID of the contact

is_client.description: Whether or not the contact is a client

is_supplier.description: Whether or not the contact is a supplier

`en-gb` | English (United Kingdom)
`el` | Greek
`fr` | French
`de` | German
`it` | Italian
`es` | Spanish
`bg` | Bulgarian
</details>

put.description:
Update a contact.
---
You must provide at least the required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. Any missing parameter will
result in keeping the old value.

client_portal_access.description: Whether the contact is allowed to access the client portal or not.

last_login.description: When the contact logged in to the client for the last time. ISO-formatted date and time.

400.description: Bad request. The exact error message is sent in the response body.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

401.description: Unauthorized request. User credentials were invalid or missing.

patch.description:
Partially update a contact.
---
The only difference between full & partial update is that the latter
will treat all parameters as optional. Any missing parameter will
result in keeping the old value.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data.

vat_number.description: The tax ID of the contact

is_client.description: Whether or not the contact is a client

is_supplier.description: Whether or not the contact is a supplier

delete.description:
Delete a contact.
---
Note that you cannot delete contacts having relations with other
objects (such as invoices, payments etc). Trying to delete such
records will result in a 400 HTTP status -with appropriate error
messages-.

parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: include_cn
parameters.description: Whether to include credit notes / purchase credit notes on the sales_purchases_chart calculations. By default they are included. Can be either ["1" or "0"]

parameters.name: only_unbilled
parameters.description: Whether to show only unbilled hours in the total hours chart. Disabled by default.Can be either ["1" or "0"]

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards.Must be used with the `period_to` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect.

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards.Must be used with the `period_from` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect.

get.description:
Get the list of invoices.
---
Objects are paginated in a set of 100 records per page by default.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. To get all the results pass the value "all".

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: search_fields
parameters.description: The fields on which search will be performed once a search term is provided. A comma-separated list. If not provided, the search operation will span across all fields. The available fields are `client__display_name`, `documenttype__title`, `series__name`, `number`, `notes`, `items__title`, `items__description`

parameters.name: documenttype
parameters.description: Optionally filter by document type

parameters.name: series
parameters.description: Optionally filter by the document's series

parameters.name: draft
parameters.description: Can be either ["1" or "0"]

parameters.name: fpaid
parameters.description: Optionally filter on whether the invoice is paid. Can be either ["yes" or "no"]

parameters.name: is_void
parameters.description: Can be either ["1" or "0"]

parameters.name: overdue
parameters.description: Optianally filter by whether the invoice is overdue. Can be either ["yes" or "no"]

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: Optionally filter by client ID

parameters.name: official
parameters.description: Optionally filter by whether the invoice's series is the official one or a custom one. Can be either ["1" or "0"]

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Optionally filter by currency code.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.A comma-separated list, if more than one is provided. The available fields are `date`, `documenttype__title`, `client__display_name`, `total`, `initial`, `net`, `draft`, `paid`, `payable`, `number`, `series__name`, `due_date`. Prepend a `-` to denote reverse ordering (e.g `-date`).

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date onwards.Must be used with the `period_to` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect.

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Optionally filter results from a date backwards.Must be used with the `period_from` parameter, otherwise it won't have any effect.

payable.description: Total payable amount. This amount may differ from the document's total amount in case withholding taxes have been applied.

due.description: The unpaid amount of the invoice

Value | Description
--- | ---

`void` | Void
`overdue` | Overdue
</details>

post.description:
Create a new invoice.
---
You must specify the document theme to use as basis for the invoice.
You may override most of the theme settings through the
`template_settings` group of fields. Any missing setting will get its
initial value from the specified theme. The same goes for the `terms`
and `public_notes` fields as well.

*Tip:* In most cases you only need to provide the document theme and
let Elorus do the rest.

As far as the client is concerned, you may choose to omit all fields
except from the client id. In this case the fields will be initialized
with values originating from the client record. For example, if you do
not specify the `client_email` parameter it will be automatically
initialized from the specified contact record. If you provide blank
values (e.g. you do send the `client_email` parameter with an empty
string value, Elorus will assume you want to leave this field blank
and will not make any modifications).

The invoice initial, net and total values will be calculated
automatically and will depend on the calculator mode and the line
items. You may correlate each item to a product. In this case you can
omit the `title`, `description`, `measurement unit` and `value` fields
to have them match the product record. As with the client fields,
specifying any of the above item fields will result in overriding the
default found on the product record.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data.

series.description: ID of the associated sales series

draft.description: If true the document is not considered to be issued

calculator_mode.description:
Automatically calculate / correct document values based on the specified calculation mode. One of the following:
<details>
<summary>List of values</summary>
Value | Description
--- | ---
`initial` | Calculate totals based on initial values
`total` | Calculate initial values based on total values
</details>

put.description:
Update an invoice.
---
You must provide at least the required fields for the record to be
successfully updated. You may only update draft invoices. To
change issued invoices you should first set them back to draft
using the partial update action.

When changing the client all client fields will be updated based on the
new contact record, unless you explicitly specify their values.

To correctly update the invoice items you must specify them all,
including their IDs and possible changes. Any missing items will be
deleted and possible new items will be created.

patch.description:
Partially update an invoice.
---
Use this action to update the invoice appearance. You can also
set the private notes or change the status. Because this method does
not affect the invoice items and values you can always use it;
on the other hand, the full update action is only available when the
document is in draft mode.

400.description: Bad request. The exact error message is sent in the response body.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

401.description: Unauthorized request. User credentials were invalid or missing.

get.description:
Get the list of user notifications across all organizations.
---
Objects are paginated in a set of 100 records per page by default.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page. To get all the results pass the value "all".

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Optionally filter by organization ID

tag.description: Further distinguish one notification from another

read.description: Was this notification read and when?

next.description: URL to the next page, if any.

previous.description: URL to the previous page, if any.

401.description: Unauthorized request. User credentials were invalid or missing.

403.description: Permission denied. User was not allowed to perform the requested action.

put.description:
Mark all notifications as read.
---
A 204 response is returned to indicate the operation
was successful.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Organization
parameters.description: The ID of the organization you want to operate on.

parameters.name: X-Elorus-Demo
parameters.description: Just send this header if you want to ensure you operate on demo organizations only. Useful while you're developing your application, to avoid accidents on production data.

is_active.description: Whether the organization is active or not

demo.description: Designates whether this is a demo organization. Demo organizations can be used by third party developers to test the API or by elorus users to have a trial on the application.

`manager` | Manager
`staff` | Staff
`partner` | Partner
</details>

</details>

OAuth2.name: Authorization
OAuth2.description:
Elorus supports OAuth2 for third-party applications that want to securely
access user data. To begin, you should contact us to 
register your application and obtain a `client_id` and a `client_secret`. 

Elorus currently only supports the Oauth2 *password* flow. To actually 
get a user *access token* you must send a `POST` request to the 
`https://api.elorus.com/oauth2/token/` endpoint. 
Your `client_id` and `client_secret` must be sent using the standard 
Basic Authentication scheme. In the request body, you must include the 
`grant_type`, `username` and `password` parameters:

* `grant_type`: Must always be set to `password`
* `username`: The email address or username of the user that your application 
wants to access.
* `password`: The password of the user that your application 
wants to access.

Example using `curl`:
 
    curl https://api.elorus.com/oauth/token/  \
    -X POST \
    -H 'Accept:application/json' \
    -u client_id:client_secret \
    -d '{ \
    "grant_type": "password", \
    "username": "user@example.com", \
    "password": "the_password" \
    }'
    
On success, you will get a response that looks like this:

    {
        "access_token": "the_access_token", 
        "token_type": "Bearer", 
        "expires_in": 86400, 
        "refresh_token": "the_refresh_token", 
        "scope": ""
    }
    
You may now go ahead and use the API, sending your `access_token` in the 
`Authorization` HTTP header as follows:

    Authorization: Bearer <the_access_token>


Once the `access_token` expires, you may use the `refresh_token` to
request a new one:
 
    curl https://api.elorus.com/oauth/token/  \
    -X POST \
    -H 'Accept:application/json' \
    -u client_id:client_secret \
    -d '{ \
    "grant_type": "refresh_token", \
    "refresh_token": "the_refresh_token" \
    }'
